    • Constructor Detail

      • HWSystem

        public HWSystem()

    • Method Detail

      • readConfig

        public void readConfig​(java.lang.String filename,
                       java.lang.String logDir)
        Reads the configuration from the given file and initializes the devices and protocols.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the configuration file
        logDir - the directory for logging data

      • addDevice

        public void addDevice​(java.lang.String dvname,
                      int port,
                      int id)
        Adds a device to the system at the specified port and assigns it an ID.
        Parameters:
        dvname - The name of the device to add (e.g., "Bluetooth", "BME280", etc.).
        port - The port number to which the device will be connected.
        id - The unique ID of the device.

      • removeDevice

        public void removeDevice​(int port)
        Removes a device from the specified port in the system.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number from which the device will be removed.

      • listPorts

        public void listPorts()
        Lists all the ports in the system along with the associated devices, their protocol type, device type, and current state. If the port is empty, it will be marked as "empty", otherwise it will display details about the device occupying the port.

      • listDevices

        public void listDevices​(java.lang.String dev)
        Lists all devices of a specified type in the system (Sensor, Display, MotorDriver, or WirelessIO). For each device, it displays its name, device ID, port ID, and the protocol associated with that port.
        Parameters:
        dev - The type of device to list. It can be "Sensor", "Display", "MotorDriver", or "WirelessIO".

      • turnOnDevice

        public void turnOnDevice​(int port)
        Turns on the device at the specified port. The device must exist at the given port and be of a valid type. If the port is valid and the device is not empty, the device will be powered on. The protocol associated with the port will also send a "turnON" command.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the device to turn on.

      • turnOffDevice

        public void turnOffDevice​(int port)
        Turns off the device at the specified port. The device must exist at the given port and be of a valid type. If the port is valid and the device is not empty, the device will be powered off. The protocol associated with the port will also send a "turnOFF" command.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the device to turn off.

      • readSensor

        public void readSensor​(int port)
        Reads data from the sensor at the specified port. The sensor must be in an ON state in order to read data. If the sensor is OFF or the port is invalid, an error message is printed. The protocol associated with the sensor's port will also attempt to read data.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the sensor to read data from.

      • printData

        public void printData​(int port,
                      java.lang.String data)
        Prints data to the display at the specified port. The display must be in an ON state in order to print data. If the display is OFF or the port is invalid, an error message is printed. The data is also sent to the protocol associated with the display's port.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the display to print data on.
        data - The data to be printed on the display.

      • changeMotorSpeed

        public void changeMotorSpeed​(int port,
                             int speed)
        Changes the speed of the motor at the specified port. The motor must be in an ON state in order to change its speed. If the motor is OFF or the port is invalid, an error message is printed. The new speed is sent to the protocol associated with the motor's port.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the motor to change speed.
        speed - The new speed to be set for the motor.

      • sndData

        public void sndData​(int port,
                    java.lang.String data)
        Sends data to the wireless I/O device at the specified port. The device must be in an ON state in order to send data. If the device is OFF or the port is invalid, an error message is printed. The data is sent to the wireless device and also passed to the associated protocol for transmission.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the wireless I/O device to send data.
        data - The data to be sent to the wireless device.

      • revData

        public void revData​(int port)
        Receives data from the wireless I/O device at the specified port. The device must be in an ON state in order to receive data. If the device is OFF or the port is invalid, an error message is printed. The received data is printed to the console and also passed to the associated protocol for reading.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the wireless I/O device from which to receive data.

      • exitting

        public void exitting()
        Closes all active protocols when the system is exiting. This method iterates through the list of protocols and calls the close method on each one to release resources and ensure proper shutdown.
